definition: to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint

sentences.english: At the same time, the studies are more clearly defining screening’s harms.
sentences.chinese: 于此同时，这项研究清楚地显示了癌症筛检的危害。

sentences.english: How should individuals with a positive indirect screening test be evaluated?
sentences.chinese: 如何评价非直接筛检阳性的受检者？

sentences.english: To assess the effects on vision of mass screening of older people for visual impairment.
sentences.chinese: 评估对老年人视力不全做大规模视力筛检之效用。

sentences.english: These patients need to be screened for occult malignancy.
sentences.chinese: 这些病人需要进行潜在恶性肿瘤筛检。

sentences.english: Germany is soon to become the first country to introduce universal skin-cancer screening.
sentences.chinese: 德国不久将成为第一个实行全面的皮肤癌筛检的国家。

sentences.english: Anemia does not interfere second trimester maternal serum screening result for Down syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 贫血并不影响妊娠中期母血唐症筛检。

sentences.english: Certain blood tests and ultrasounds are commonly available genetic screening tests in pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 血液检查和超音波检查是常用的妊娠遗传筛检。

sentences.english: The low-cost of this RDS test makes it especially suitable for nationwide screening of stereopsis in preschool children.
sentences.chinese: 它的低成本尤其适合推广以为全国性大规模筛检之用。

definition: see 體格檢查|体格检查[ti3 ge2 jian3 cha2]
biopsy/abbr. for 活體組織檢查|活体组织检查[huo2 ti3 zu3 zhi1 jian3 cha2]
to accompany/(of a doctor etc) to do a follow-up (on a patient, client etc)
biopsy/abbr. to 活檢|活检[huo2 jian3]
pinyin: huo2 ti3 zu3 zhi1 jian3 cha2

definition: to do a blood test/to have one's blood tested
(Tw) medical checkup/physical examination (abbr. for 健康檢查|健康检查[jian4 kang1 jian3 cha2])
